name: Brighton & Hove Albion FC Quiz | Brighton and Hove Albion | 10 Questions

questions.text: By what name was the club known by when they were formed?
questions.explanation:
Brighton United.

	The club was formed in 1897, and a year later played in the Southern League. The club then went bust and reformed as Brighton & Hove Rangers, but they disappeared before playing a game, and were replaced with Brighton & Hove United, who were forced to change the name to Brighton & Hove Albion shortly after.

questions.text: Who was the club's first manager in their history?
questions.explanation:
John Jackson.

	Jackson managed the club between 1901-1905.

questions.text: In 1957-1958, Brighton won their first ever Football League division title. Which of these was that?
questions.explanation:
League Division Three (South).

	This was the only time in the 20th century that Brighton won the Division Three (South) title, and they won it with 60 points over second placed Brentford, who had 58.

questions.text: From which club did Brighton sign Bobby Zamora in 2000?
questions.explanation:
Bristol City.

	Zamora never played a full game for Bristol, and was snapped up by Brighton after a brief loan spell at Bath City.

questions.text: Whose ground did Brighton share between 1997-1999?
questions.explanation:
Gillingham's.

	Brighton played at the Goldstone Ground between 1902-97, then ground-shared Priestfield Stadium with Gillingham, before returning home to Brighton in the Withdean Stadium.

questions.text: Which of these played the most games for the club?
questions.explanation:
Tug Wilson.

	Wilson played 509 games between 1922-1936.

questions.text: In what season did Brighton first play in the Football League?
questions.explanation:
1920-1921.

	The club entered the Football League Division Three in the 1920-21 season, and finished 18th out of 22 teams.

questions.text: All of the following played for Brighton in the 1980's, but which one also played in the 1970's for the club?
questions.explanation:
Mark Lawrenson.

	Mark Lawrenson played for Brighton between 1977-1981, and scored 5 goals in 152 games. Case was between 1981-1985 and amassed 127 games and 10 goals. Grealish was 1981-1984 and scored 6 goals in 100 games, and Ritchie scored 23 goals in 89 games between 1980-1983.

questions.text: Brighton won a league game 9-1 in 1954, to set the record for their highest league victory. Who were they playing?
questions.explanation:
Newport County.

	The game took place on April 18, 1954.

questions.text: In the 1976-1977 season, Peter Ward scored how many goals for Brighton?
questions.explanation:
32.

	This set the record for the most goals scored in a season for Brighton.
